page.title: 05INDUSTRY AND BUSINESSES
page.content: The Parkwood Trading Estate was established about 30 years ago and is still growing. It contains both large and small businesses. Three long- established car-sale and repair firms employ about 500 people between them, while a BMX bike firm set up in 1982 only employs 15 people. Other estate occupants include a steel engineers, a dairy, a chemist wholesalers, an elecrode paper manufacturer, and a firm producing crackers, balloons and other novelties. Before the Leonard Gould factory in Pickering Street was built in 1926, the land was farmed. Since then the factory has grown to cover its present 5.5 acres. It employs about 150 people and specializes in packaging. Around Boughton Green are some small businesses, including Astra Lamp bulb factory, Kent Valves, and a pottery.
